lyrics.text: On a terrace down in France beneath the sun
Sits a man who until yesterday had never won
He reads the paper sitting in his easy chair
It says that he has passed away, but he is standing there
His car had crashed and burned a mile away from home
But he had sold it just an hour before he chose to roam
And the man who bought the car, he took the fall
His name is in the black-rimmed page for one and all
Oh, oh, oh, just take a breath and calm it down
Oh, oh, oh, it looks like rain is falling on this town
But it's raining, yes it's raining sunbeams now
Yeah, it's raining, strictly raining sunbeams now
A week ago in Amsterdam, inside the park
He saw his life was plotted out and lost its spark
A man whose destiny was written on the wall
Of all his boyhood dreams, he'd only achieved growing old, that's all
So on that bench he made a choice to slip away
Call it brave or call it running, he was gone that day
Now he has got a second chance to start again
More freedom than he wanted, he is wondering "what then?"
But Herman pays the bill and walks into the light
The wind is in his hair, he knows that he will be alright
Oh, oh, oh, just take a breath and calm it down
Oh, oh, oh, it looks like rain is falling on this town
But it's raining, yes it's raining sunbeams now (It is raining sunbeams)
If this is it... well this is it
We will see
It's raining sunbeams.
